summary: This is an email chain from October 2020 between law enforcement officials discussing documents sent by Jason Richards regarding the Epstein case. The emails focus on categorizing documents, with specific attention to a two-page attachment: a voucher for a cellphone possibly seized in 1999 and a missing person report for a witness.

persons.name: Jason Richards
persons.context: Sent paper documents to law enforcement regarding the Epstein case, including a cellphone voucher and a missing person report.

events.title: Possible cellphone seizure
events.description: A voucher for a cellphone that may have been seized in 1999 is referenced in the documents.

events.title: Document review
events.description: A law enforcement official reviewed paper documents sent by Jason Richards via FedEx, categorizing them as witness statements, MySpace printouts, or background reports.

keyFacts: Jason Richards provided documents to law enforcement related to the Epstein investigation, including a cellphone voucher from 1999 and a missing person report.
The majority of the documents were categorized as witness statements, MySpace printouts of non-statutory victims, or background reports on witnesses/victims.
The cellphone voucher is specifically noted as an item of interest, with a request to check if the FBI still possesses the phone.
